channel.title: R on Øystein Sørensen
channel.description: Recent content in R on Øystein Sørensen

item.title: Presentation of metagam at ERUM2020
item.description: The European R User Meeting 2020 has so far been a really great event, with interesting talks and online presentations working smoothly. I presented the metagam package this morning, and the slides are available here.

item.title: Slides from talk at Oslo UseR! Group
item.description: Tonight I gave a presentation of Rcpp at the Oslo UseR! Group. The slides are here. It was a nice opportunity to meet some of the many R users in town. Thanks to Deemah for organizing!

item.title: In Which Language is R Written?
item.description: In preparing for my upcoming Rcpp talk at the Oslo useR! Group, I started wondering how much of R is actually written in C or Fortran. I have of course been trained to think that vectorization is great, because then you let C or Fortran do the job, but how much of R is actually written in these languages? Some searching led me to this blog, which analyzes R-2.
